body_html:
If your concern is speed, I saw a ~25% improvement when I switched to c++ over python for image classification (not training). I know in theory the heavy lifting in python is handled by compiled c/c++ binaries, but in practice it looks like there is still some slowdown.

Also, you may see substantial speedup if you use a GPU, assuming you are running many images through the classifier.
body_text:
If your concern is speed, I saw a ~25% improvement when I switched to c++ over python for image classification (not training). I know in theory the heavy lifting in python is handled by compiled c/c++ binaries, but in practice it looks like there is still some slowdown.
Also, you may see substantial speedup if you use a GPU, assuming you are running many images through the classifier.
body:
If your concern is speed, I saw a ~25% improvement when I switched to c++ over python for image classification (not training). I know in theory the heavy lifting in python is handled by compiled c/c++ binaries, but in practice it looks like there is still some slowdown.

Also, you may see substantial speedup if you use a GPU, assuming you are running many images through the classifier.
